Came clean to everyone I know (all very supportive) Been a closet oxy user for years... had some good clean time before lapsing the last 8 days prior to Saturday. 60-100mg habit, 1.75 year habit with some clean time mixed in.
Dropping the Lope to 6mg today, plan on working out after work, dropping the Benzo to .25mg today and .75mg tonight before bed.
finished the day with 6mg lope, .25 kpin and 1 Gabapentin before bed
Physically, most of everything has passed.
Waking up to day 7. Sleep was total shit and so is this morning.
One week down, working on day 8.
Eight days down, moving into day 9. Not as cool as r/The_Motel 's 112 but better than nothing.
10 down. Working on 11.

I'm still a lot of things that fuckin suck... BUT I'm noticing glimmers. Sometimes they come and go in an instant, sometimes they stick around a few minutes, sometimes I can stretch them for 1-2 hours. Piece by piece, glimmer by glimmer, I'm working to rebuild.

This shit isn't easy... but that shouldn't be the reason you don't stop using. It's not supposed to be easy, you're trying to rescue your hijacked brain and body from something that's held it hostage for however long.
maybe a little Friday night relax smoke session with a friend
I was talking to someone last night about how most of us do enough research to have PhDs in this shit.
about to head to the gym in hopes of pumping some natural feel good into my body
Not sure if I've ever experienced the "pink cloud" before. Maybe I think about shit too much.
Today I feel... decent? It feels like my body is trying to act normal and my brain is just a few steps behind.

I can say that I have never had a craving in the 17 days up until that point. It hit me like a fuckin sack of bricks... started pouring sweat, plotting and rationalizing all the ways I could get around this security blanket that I've created, giving myself reasons as to why it would be okay,
Closing in on 3 weeks, Still some morning GI stuff. Clams come and go.
Yesterday was okay minus a crazy afternoon episode of the sweats. Lingering symptoms are still morning GI/Restless when I try to relax/anxiety sweats.
Symptoms at 3 weeks out... broken sleep of 4-6 hours, morning shits (a very zen one this morning at least), anhedonia waves, come and go restless limbs.
I felt like day 4 of withdrawals out of the blue.
Only things lingering around at 25 days are morning GI, restless sleep, anxiety/anhedonia waves.
This was the day of the month I would get my script refilled and normally start the process of one GREAT week followed by the cycle of withdrawal etc etc.

I made a very big deal out of this appointment, which I discovered was simply my addiction rearing its head. ... I instructed my daughter to inform the dentist that I could have only 10 pills and I gave them to my husband. Well, I didn't take one.

That phenomenon of craving is so fucking real, and there has never been any doubt that I'm a true-blue addict regarding these pills. I have nearly 6 months sober and although I haven't relapsed... I know in my heart that I would absolutely relapse if those things were in my possession.

I would always get clean for a month or two, or three, and think to myself "Wow is this what being clean is like? If so, then I'm never going to succeed because I still feel extremely far from normal". I would then relapse: then use until I ran out of money or got caught by a DT, or whatever it was that would make me start the 'cleanliness' cycle all over again.

I remember when I was using that if I was honest with myself, the answer was always that I wanted to change things and wanted to stop- but the next thought would be that I needed to make a plan first, and certainly couldn’t start right then, because I wanted to do it ‘right’. And if not that, then it would be some other complete bullshit nonsense excuse that my brain would trick me into believing, thus delaying doing what I knew deep down that I really wanted to do.

Myself as well as the large majority of opiate users I have met along my journey through recovery all have almost the same story. Got injured in some way, got prescribed Vicodin, Percocet, Oxys, even fucking Fentanyl in some cases- and then, after unknowingly becoming physically dependent on the medication (which the doctors often failed to warn about), the doc suddenly ends the script.

If someone who is on subs, methadone, or using, and has been wanting to jump off/get clean... I wonder if this situation would make it “easier” both physically and mentally, since you know you are going to feel that way regardless of using or not.
I was in recovery, and actually a year or so into it at that point. I’ll never forget it- constant memories of using and wanting to use.

I got dizzy and nauseous and angry, I felt attacked (which is nuts).

I'm still free and clear... My body is like an old, tired sock... I keep wanting to stretch out, shake and use my muscles a bit. I'm so weak, it's been years.
I have been clean for two weeks now. No opiates. No drinking. No caffeine.

I'm doing it, guys, one day at a time. Oh, and, by the by... the family is planning a big trip for this summer. Our first EVER vacation together. And I plan to be one super-sober traveller, apart from maybe an occasional glass of wine,
I didn't even think to bring a damn Advil in my bag.
Three weeks ago I was in hell. My body went through an absolute horror show of pain. Fever, shakes, nausea, muscle cramps... insomnia, jesus.
I am clean, I am alive, I am beginning to feel comfortable in my skin.
Normal poo! Hallelujah, my colon has finally forgiven me!
First time, after 4.5 weeks, brain says to me 'hey, just a thougt, I kinda miss getting high...'

I have been clean for ten weeks and three days -- I genuinely lost track. Getting off the shit was hell.
